question_text: Which configuration scenario is most likely to cause performance issues due to asymmetric memory access in a quad-channel setup?
answer_options: Installing identical memory modules across all slots
Using four different capacity modules in each channel
Leaving two slots empty while using matched modules in the others
Using ECC memory in a non-ECC motherboard
correct_answer: Using four different capacity modules in each channel
explanation: Using memory modules of varying capacity in a multi-channel setup may disable channel interleaving and reduce performance, resulting in asymmetric access.
